narrator_intro.speaker: Narrator
narrator_intro.text: As the company makes camp for the night, Lyra approaches you by the fire. Her expression is troubled.

lyra_opening.speaker: Lyra
lyra_opening.text: Commander, a word? I've been thinking about our recent work... these contracts from Ironmark.

lyra_concern.speaker: Lyra
lyra_concern.text: Those bandits in the ruins - some of them were just farmers and tradesmen. Driven to desperation. Ironmark's taxes have been crushing the common folk.

lyra_accusation.speaker: Lyra
lyra_accusation.text: We're being used as his enforcers. Clearing out anyone who resists his rule. Is this really the kind of work our company should be taking?

choice_defend_ironmark.text: [Defend Ironmark] The law is the law. These men chose banditry.

choice_agree_lyra.text: [Agree] You're right. I'm having doubts about Ironmark too.

choice_neutral.text: [Neutral] We're mercenaries. We go where the gold is.

lyra_response_defend.speaker: Lyra
lyra_response_defend.text: The law? Ironmark IS the law in these parts. He writes it to serve himself. I expected more from you, Commander.

thorne_interject_defend.speaker: Thorne
thorne_interject_defend.text: The Commander's right, Lyra. Order must be maintained. Without it, chaos consumes everything. I've seen it before.

lyra_response_agree.speaker: Lyra
lyra_response_agree.text: I'm glad you see it too. The next contract... we should be careful about what we're really being asked to do.

thorne_interject_agree.speaker: Thorne
thorne_interject_agree.text: Commander, with respect - Ironmark has been a reliable employer. Don't let sentiment cloud our judgment. War isn't pretty.

lyra_response_neutral.speaker: Lyra
lyra_response_neutral.text: Mercenaries... is that all we are? I thought this company stood for something more. Maybe I was wrong.

thorne_interject_neutral.speaker: Thorne
thorne_interject_neutral.text: The Commander keeps us fed and paid. That's what matters in uncertain times.

narrator_closing.speaker: Narrator
narrator_closing.text: The tension lingers in the air as the fire crackles. Your next contract may force you to make a difficult choice.
